thread.title: Oshawa couple allegedly sold fentanyl from car with baby in back seat
thread.title_full: Oshawa couple allegedly sold fentanyl from car with baby in back seat

title: Oshawa couple allegedly sold fentanyl from car with baby in back seat

organizations.name: alberta law enforcement response teams / the canadian press

text:
Advertisement Oshawa couple allegedly sold fentanyl from car with baby in back seat 
Fentanyl pills are shown in a handout photo. (Alberta Law Enforcement Response Teams / The Canadian Press) The Canadian Press   3:22PM EST 
OSHAWA, Ont. -- Police say a couple of alleged drug dealers had a baby with them as they sold fentanyl in a city east of Toronto. 
Durham regional police say officers conducting an ongoing drug investigation saw two people allegedly making drug deals from a car in Oshawa, Ont., on Wednesday afternoon. 
Investigators say when they moved in to arrest the pair, a baby was found in the back seat. 
They say fentanyl and cash were seized and the infant was turned over to a family member. 
Police say a search warrant executed at an Oshawa home resulted in the seizure of drug paraphernalia. 
A 34-year-old man and a 27-year-old woman -- both from Oshawa -- are charged with possession for the purpose of trafficking. Related Stories
